channel.title: X times Ai
channel.description: Recent content on X times Ai

item.title: Keep Your Faith Strong and Your Patience
item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description:
Keep Your Faith Strong and Your Patience Steady: Everything is Coming Together for You

The world can often feel overwhelming, unpredictable, and even discouraging. The pace of change, coupled with global challenges, can shake the most steadfast hearts. Yet, amidst this chaos, a simple yet profound truth remains: everything is coming together for you. This belief isn’t just optimism; it’s a mindset shift that can transform how you navigate lifeâ€™s trials.

item.title: Be Your Own Life Coach: 10 Essential Steps to Enjoying a Life You Love
item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description: Life coaching doesn’t always require hiring a professional. With dedication, self-awareness, and the right tools, you can become your own most effective life coach. This guide will walk you through ten essential steps to transform your life and create lasting positive change.

item.title: Getting Started with Hugo: A Beginner's Guide
item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description:
Getting Started with Hugo: A Beginner’s Guide

Prerequisites

Before starting with Hugo, make sure you have:

  • A GitHub account
  • Basic knowledge of command prompt/terminal
  • A text editor (like VS Code)

Installation Guide (Windows)

  1. Download Hugo

item.title: How to Build a $20k/Month Website Business: A Complete Guide
item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description:
Introduction

Want to know how some people make doctor-level income selling websites? The secret isn’t in creating complex custom websites from scratch - it’s in working smarter with templates and providing real value to local businesses. This guide breaks down a proven process that has helped people transition from struggling freelancers to successful digital entrepreneurs.

item.title: A Beginner's Guide to Hugo Shortcodes
item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description:
A Beginner’s Guide to Hugo Shortcodes

What are Hugo Shortcodes?

Hugo shortcodes are special templates that let you easily add rich content to your website without writing complex HTML code. Think of them as simple shortcuts for inserting things like videos, tweets, and other media into your pages.

item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description:
A Beginner’s Guide to Markdown Syntax

Table of Contents

  1. Headings
  2. Paragraphs
  3. Text Styling
  4. Images
  5. Examples

Headings

Headings are created using the hash symbol (#). The number of hashes determines the heading level:

item.title: Understanding Markdown: A Beginner's Guide
item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description:
Understanding Markdown: A Beginner’s Guide

What is Markdown?

Markdown is a simple way to format text that looks great on any device. Think of it as a simplified version of HTML or a smarter way to write for the web.

item.title: Beginner's Guide to Using a Hugo Theme
item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description:
Beginner’s Guide to Using a Hugo Theme

Prerequisites

Before you begin, ensure you have:

  1. Hugo installed on your system
  2. A code editor (like VS Code, Sublime Text, etc.)
  3. Basic familiarity with command line operations

Step 1: Theme Installation

  1. Download the theme from the source
  2. Unzip the downloaded file
  3. Navigate to the theme folder:
cd lightbi-hugo-master

Step 2: Project Structure

The theme folder should contain these essential directories:

item.title: Host a Static Website for Free on Netlify
item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description:
Hosting Your Hugo Website for Free on Netlify

What is Netlify?

Netlify is like a free hosting service for your website - think of it as a place that makes your website available to everyone on the internet. It’s especially good for static websites (like those built with Hugo) because:

item.title: Youtube Test Copy
item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description:
Introduction

As a beginner to Hugo, one of the first things you’ll want to do is create a custom theme for your blog. A custom theme allows you to personalize the look and feel of your website, making it unique and reflective of your brand.

åœ¨ Netlify ä¸Šå…è´¹æ‰˜ç®¡æ‚¨çš„ Hugo ç½‘ç«™

ä»€ä¹ˆæ˜¯ Netlifyï¼Ÿ

Netlify æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå…è´¹çš„ç½‘ç«™æ‰˜ç®¡æœåŠ¡ - å¯ä»¥å°†å…¶è§†ä¸ºè®©æ‰€æœ‰äººéƒ½èƒ½åœ¨äº’è”ç½‘ä¸Šè®¿é—®æ‚¨ç½‘ç«™çš„å¹³å°ã€‚å®ƒç‰¹åˆ«é€‚åˆé™æ€ç½‘ç«™ï¼ˆå¦‚ä½¿ç”¨ Hugo æ„å»ºçš„ç½‘ç«™ï¼‰ï¼Œå› ä¸ºï¼š

  • åŸºç¡€ä½¿ç”¨å®Œå…¨å…è´¹
  • é€Ÿåº¦éå¸¸å¿«
  • è®¾ç½®ç®€å•
  • å½“æ‚¨è¿›è¡Œæ›´æ”¹æ—¶è‡ªåŠ¨æ›´æ–°ç½‘ç«™

åœ¨ Netlify ä¸Šè®¾ç½®æ‚¨çš„ç½‘ç«™

ç¬¬ä¸€æ­¥ï¼šå‡†å¤‡é…ç½®

åœ¨é¡¹ç›®ä¸»æ–‡ä»¶å¤¹ä¸­åˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªåä¸º netlify.toml çš„æ–‡ä»¶ã€‚æ­¤æ–‡ä»¶å‘Šè¯‰ Netlify å¦‚ä½•å¤„ç†æ‚¨çš„ç½‘ç«™ï¼š

[build]
publish = "public"          # å‘Šè¯‰ Netlify æ‚¨çš„å®Œæˆç½‘ç«™æ–‡ä»¶åœ¨å“ªé‡Œ
command = "hugo --gc --minify"  # å‘Šè¯‰ Netlify ä½¿ç”¨ Hugo æ„å»ºæ‚¨çš„ç½‘ç«™

# ä¸»ç½‘ç«™çš„è®¾ç½®
[context.production.environment]
HUGO_VERSION = "0.82.0"    # æŒ‡å®šä½¿ç”¨çš„ Hugo ç‰ˆæœ¬
HUGO_ENV = "production"    # å‘Šè¯‰ Hugo è¿™æ˜¯ç”¨äºæ‚¨çš„æ­£å¼ç½‘ç«™
HUGO_ENABLEGITINFO = "true"  # å…è®¸ Hugo ä½¿ç”¨ Git ä¿¡æ¯

# ä¸åŒéƒ¨ç½²åœºæ™¯çš„è®¾ç½®
[context.split1]
command = "hugo --gc --minify --enableGitInfo"

[context.split1.environment]
HUGO_VERSION = "0.82.0"
HUGO_ENV = "production"

# é¢„è§ˆéƒ¨ç½²çš„è®¾ç½®ï¼ˆå½“æ‚¨æƒ³æµ‹è¯•æ›´æ”¹æ—¶ï¼‰
[context.deploy-preview]
command = "hugo --gc --minify --buildFuture -b $DEPLOY_PRIME_URL"

[context.deploy-preview.environment]
HUGO_VERSION = "0.82.0"

# åˆ†æ”¯éƒ¨ç½²çš„è®¾ç½®
[context.branch-deploy]
command = "hugo -b $DEPLOY_PRIME_URL"

[context.branch-deploy.environment]
HUGO_VERSION = "0.82.0"

[context.next.environment]
HUGO_ENABLEGITINFO = "true"

ç¬¬äºŒæ­¥ï¼šé€‰æ‹©éƒ¨ç½²æ–¹å¼

æ‚¨æœ‰ä¸¤ç§æ–¹å¼å°†ç½‘ç«™éƒ¨ç½²åˆ° Netlifyï¼š

item.title: How to use this Hugo theme ?
item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description:
After downloading the theme, unzip the file and go to the ’lightbi-hugo-master’ folder. Open the folder in you editor and run the hugo build command as below.

hugo

It will create a folder named ‘public’ and in the same you can find the website created by Hugo from the contents from ‘content’ folder and the theme. To check the website you can run the below command,

item.title: Build a Hugo Blog
item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description:
Hugo?

Itâ€™s a fast and static website generator written in the Go language. Websites built with Hugo can be hosted anywhere from GitHub Pages to Amazon S3 without any database or other language dependencies.

item.title: Note 1
item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description: Journaling is not just a little thing you do to pass the time, to write down your memoriesâ€”though it can beâ€”itâ€™s a strategy that has helped brilliant, powerful and wise people become better at what they do.

item.title: What is Markdown ?
item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description:
What is Markdown?

The Markdown Guide is a free and open-source reference guide that explains how to use Markdown, the simple and easy-to-use markup language you can use to format virtually any document.

item.title: Basic Syntax
item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description:
Headings

To create a heading, add number signs (#) in front of a word or phrase. The number of number signs you use should correspond to the heading level. For example, to create a heading level three (h3), use three number signs (e.g., ### My Header). Â

item.title: Rich Content
item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Host in Netlify
item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description:
You can host your static website wth zero cost in Netlify.

Add the below netlify.toml in the root folder.

[build]
publish = "public"
command = "hugo --gc --minify"

[context.production.environment]
HUGO_VERSION = "0.82.0"
HUGO_ENV = "production"
HUGO_ENABLEGITINFO = "true"

[context.split1]
command = "hugo --gc --minify --enableGitInfo"

[context.split1.environment]
HUGO_VERSION = "0.82.0"
HUGO_ENV = "production"

[context.deploy-preview]
command = "hugo --gc --minify --buildFuture -b $DEPLOY_PRIME_URL"

[context.deploy-preview.environment]
HUGO_VERSION = "0.82.0"

[context.branch-deploy]
command = "hugo -b $DEPLOY_PRIME_URL"

[context.branch-deploy.environment]
HUGO_VERSION = "0.82.0"

[context.next.environment]
HUGO_ENABLEGITINFO = "true"

And you can upload the public folder directly to Netlify or integrate your GitHub accout with Netlify to host your website.

item.title: Who am I ?!
item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description:
Who am I ?! This is the most asked question in my life. Yet no clear answer has yet been found.

As a child, the answer to this question was simple. Say my name to the question of who. Aha ..! Simple and beautiful. In that answer, parents and siblings in adolescence. I thought to myself that the answer was too clear.

item.author: johnazureengineer@gmail.com (John Liu)
item.description:
Be Patient: Things Will Change for the Better

In life’s most challenging moments, patience emerges as our steadfast companion, guiding us through uncertainty toward brighter horizons. While the path forward may sometimes seem unclear, understanding the power of patience can transform our perspective and help us navigate difficult times with grace and resilience.
